title: HPI Spencer
content: Kathy Smith is a patient presenting for follow-up of her bilateral hand pain and swelling, which she reports has persisted despite prior therapy. She states she has been doing okay overall but is not particularly thrilled with her hand therapy and would like to return to Jack for care. She reports ongoing swelling and pain in her hands. On exam, her surgical incisions are healing with minimal scarring, and there is some continued tenderness to palpation at the A1 pulley incision site. There is no tendon subluxation at the dorsal hand, and the area appears scarred. She has full fist formation with moderate soft tissue swelling, especially in the left hand, and excellent range of motion overall, though she continues to experience pain with motion.
